nodes.bodyText: Can you manually confirm that this is correct - we don't use .update() often

According to doc, this last argument represents values for the ?
There seems to be no reason to prefer update to execute, or reciprocally. It seems they both do similar thing. It's hard to actually state whether one is better since those are name of interface functions.
execute accepts Object...
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1595,14 +1595,14 @@ public CheckDatabaseResult fixIntegrity(CollectionTask.ProgressCallback progress
         getDecks().flush();
 
         mDb.execute("update cards " +
-                        "set did = " + nextDeckId + ", " +
+                        "set did = ?, " +
                         "odid = 0," +
-                        "mod = " +  getTime().intTime() + ", " +
-                        "usn = " + usn() + " " +
+                        "mod = ?, " +
+                        "usn = ? " +
                         "where did in " +
                         Utils.ids2str(dynDeckIds) +
                         "and odid in " +
-                        Utils.ids2str(dynIdsAndZero));
+                        Utils.ids2str(dynIdsAndZero), new Object[] {nextDeckId, getTime().intTime(), usn()});

nodes.bodyText: Oh right,

IMO, This is adding too much complexity - I'd be tempted to move it back, unless emptyDyn() is on a critical path.
No. Deleting an empty filtered deck is clearly not a critical path. I'll remove

On second though, i'm surprised. I'd find this one quite easier to understand, since both functions have a single parameter tehy use, instead of checking whether a value is null, if only in this case uses the other one
Done, even if I I'd still prefer the other version
